title: Everyday English Course 65
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: To give a letter to Mary.
instances.correctAnswer: To give a letter to Mary.

variables.a: What is the man going to do?
Where are the man and woman going?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Don't you like the coat you just tried on?
W: Well, I like the color and fabric.
M: And it is really nice and reasonably priced.
W: Yes. I would have bought it right away if they had had it in my size.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Don't you like the coat you just tried on?
W: Well, I like the color and fabric.
M: And it is really nice and reasonably priced.
W: Yes. I would have bought it right away if they had had it in my size.
{a}

variables.a: Why doesn't the woman buy the coat?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Let's have a short break. Which would you like to drink, coffee, juice or tea?
W: A cup of tea please. How about you?
M: Iced coffee as usual. It can keep my mind sharp.
{a}

{a}

variables.a: What drink will the man take?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Can I help you?
W: Yes. Are there any spare rooms here?
M: Would you be interested in a three-bedroom flat? I have a few now.
W: That might be more rooms than I need. I don't have much furniture.
{a}

W: Yes. Are there any spare rooms here?
M: Would you be interested in a three-bedroom flat? I have a few now.

{a}

variables.a: What does the woman need?
What will the woman probably do this evening?

answerOptions: It was probably Mr. Brown's phone number that the woman wrote down.
It was just an hour ago that the man met Mr. Brown.
The woman forgot to write down the phone number.
instances.correctAnswer: It was probably Mr. Brown's phone number that the woman wrote down.

variables.a: What do we learn from this conversation?
Where might the hotel be?

answerOptions: The woman can't tolerate any noise.
The man is looking for an apartment.
The man has missed his appointment.
instances.correctAnswer: The man is looking for an apartment.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation?
Can the woman arrive at the airport before 11'o clock?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What is the weather like?
Where did the conversation take place?
Where does this conversation most likely take place?

answerOptions: He keeps thinking of going to the movies.
His classmates are taking a break.
He's been studying for too long.
instances.correctAnswer: He's been studying for too long.

variables.a: Why can't the man concentrate on his study?

answerOptions: He likes both Beijing and New York.
He likes neither Beijing nor New York.
He likes Beijing, but he doesn't like New York.
instances.correctAnswer: He likes both Beijing and New York.

variables.a: What does Mike mean?

answerOptions: Mary was expected to come yesterday.
Mary didn't come because she was ill.
instances.correctAnswer: Mary was expected to come yesterday.

variables.a: What can we learn from the dialogue?
How does Kate come to school?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Why didn't you call me yesterday? I was waiting by the phone all day.
W: I'm sorry, I couldn't call. I couldn't find a phone.
M: What do you mean you couldn't call? You have a cell phone, don't you?
W: I used to have a cell phone. The teacher took it away because I tried to call you from class.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Why didn't you call me yesterday? I was waiting by the phone all day.
W: I'm sorry, I couldn't call. I couldn't find a phone.

answerOptions: Her teacher took her cellphone away.
instances.correctAnswer: Her teacher took her cellphone away.

variables.a: Why didn't the woman call the man yesterday?

answerOptions: He's known Margie for a long time.
instances.correctAnswer: He's known Margie for a long time.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

answerOptions: She wants to keep the window tidy.
She doesn't like the man's idea.

variables.a: What do you learn about the woman?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Good afternoon. This is Mr. Black's office.
M: Good afternoon. This is Mr. White at the Friendship Hotel. Is Mr. Black there?
W: No, he is out for lunch. Would you please call half an hour later?
{a}

{a}

answerOptions: He was not surprised about it.

variables.a: How does the man react to the news?
When does the first bus leave on Saturday?

answerOptions: He has bought a new one.
He lost his old one and borrowed a new one.
He didn't have any dictionary then.
instances.correctAnswer: He didn't have any dictionary then.

variables.a: What did the man say about his dictionary?

answerOptions: He is quite easy to recognize.
He looks like a movie star.
instances.correctAnswer: He is quite easy to recognize.

answerOptions: He didn't like traveling in Guilin
He spent three days in Guilin

variables.a: What do we know about the man?

questionTemplates.text_en:
A: What nationality are you?
B: I'm Australian. I was born in Melbourne.
A: Oh, yes. That's the capital, isn't it?
B: No, no. Canberra.
{a}
